findings.title: blacklist
findings.description: Consider possible security implications associated with the subprocess module.
findings.code_snippet:
8 import sqlite3
9 import subprocess
10 import hashlib
findings.recommendation: Review and fix the identified security issue

findings.title: hardcoded_password_string
findings.recommendation: Review and fix the identified security issue

findings.title: hardcoded_sql_expressions
findings.description: Possible SQL injection vector through string-based query construction.
findings.code_snippet:
21     # Vulnerable: Direct string concatenation in SQL query
22     query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = '{username}'"
23     cursor.execute(query)
findings.recommendation: Review and fix the identified security issue

findings.title: subprocess_popen_with_shell_equals_true
findings.description: subprocess call with shell=True identified, security issue.
findings.code_snippet:
32     command = f"cat {filename}"
33     result = subprocess.run(command, shell=True, capture_output=True, text=True)
34     return result.stdout
findings.recommendation: Review and fix the identified security issue

findings.title: hashlib
findings.description: Use of weak MD5 hash for security. Consider usedforsecurity=False
findings.code_snippet:
38     # Vulnerable: Using MD5 for password hashing (weak)
39     return hashlib.md5(password.encode()).hexdigest()
40
findings.recommendation: Review and fix the identified security issue
